H0.text: What is the US equivalent of the British Army's SAS. Delta Force

H1.text: What is the US equivalent of the British Army's SAS. Navy SEAL Team Six

H2.text: What is the US equivalent of the British Army's SAS. US Army Rangers

H3.text: What is the US equivalent of the British Army's SAS. SFOD-D

A4.text: Delta Force's structure is similar to the British 22 SAS Regiment, which inspired Delta's formation.

A5.text: The 1st Special Forces Operational Detachment–Delta (1st SFOD-D), also known as Delta Force, is a special operations force of the United States Army under the operational control of JSOC.

A6.text: The American unit, 1st Special Forces Operational Detachment-Delta, was formed by Colonel Charles Alvin Beckwith, who served with 22 SAS as an exchange officer, and recognised the need for a similar type of unit in the United States Army.

A7.text: Naval Special Warfare Development Group (also known as DEVGRU or SEAL Team 6) – Based at the Dam Neck Annex, NAS Oceana, Virginia Beach, Virginia, assigned operationally to JSOC

A8.text: The 1st Special Forces Operational Detachment–Delta (1st SFOD-D), also known as Delta Force, is a special operations force of the United States Army under the operational control of JSOC
